Edited April 27, 2013 by Boex
Some have done it with the Airship mod.

It looks like you went straight up until your apoapsis was 100 km, RatoZumbi. That's a rather inefficient trajectory, look for some tutorials about making a gravity turn. On Eve you want to start it higher than on Kerbin, because of the thicker atmosphere, maybe around 25-30 km. With a good trajectory and a design that has enough thrust to stay close to terminal velocity, the delta-V for Eve ascent ranges from around 8000 m/s to about 10000 m/s depending whether you land on the highest mountains (altitude 6400 m above sea level) or at sea level.

Command Pod Mk1

ASAS

SAS

FL-T800 Fuel Tank

Toroidal Aerospike Rocket

With a TWR of only 1.5 you're wasting a lot of fuel there. Boost the TWR and fiddle with the ascent profile and you can knock a thousand m/s off that, possibly two.

Last time I fiddled with working it out the smallest value I was able to achieve (from 50m above sea level) was 10,109m/s. That was in a previous version of the game so it may have changed slightly but I don't believe 12,400m/s is a minimum with your low TWR.

Edited April 27, 2013 by EndlessWaves
Using an balloon to get up to 20 km I was able to get out with around 6.000 m/s, the thick atmosphere is the real killer on Eve and the balloon turn it into an good thing.
